nodes.bodyText: Was this class only extracted from SearchPhaseController or what changes have been made to it? Maybe for easier reviewing it could have stayed where it was, at least initially? Would that be possible?
We could but the change is substantial so I don't think it would help. This PR is a complete rewrite of the QueryPhaseResultConsumer.
Yeah. This looks so much bigger than before and I don't think it would have made review a ton easier to keep it where it was.
Maybe add some prefix to the message? I am always afraid that the exc message may be null or not so understandable, with a prefix we would know for sure where the cancel comes from.
why do we need to do this compared to before?
That's an unrelated change sorry :(. I removed it from this pr.
I think it is worth a comment about why you can't use reducedAggs != null. I believe the reason for that is that you want to set this to true before the reduced aggs are ready.
Do you see the task being consumed twice? It is probably worth a comment explaining why.
If the task is cancelled, we nullify the buffer in the task. That's why we need this check, I added a comment in 1fa4880
Did you keep the same class here because folks are used to setting the logger for SearchPhaseController? If so, its worth a comment. If no, I'd switch this to QueryPhaseResultConsumer.
I switched to QueryPhaseResultConsumer, thanks for noticing
I think it is more clear to write this is DelayableWriteable.Serialized<InternalAggregations>.
